messages: 78bd2344ca343a42996f1c5e8e4fdac8 (01:28): there will be no need in Flash plugin in html5-able browsers ?
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (01:30): 78bd2344ca343a42996f1c5e8e4fdac8: you still need Flash do deal with legacy websites
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (01:30): 78bd2344ca343a42996f1c5e8e4fdac8: if you have a HTML5 site and a HTML5 browser you don't need Flash
78bd2344ca343a42996f1c5e8e4fdac8 (01:31): what about youtube videos ?
a26a1644beeab8cb4f433e21fb297199 (01:32): http://www.youtube.com/html5
78bd2344ca343a42996f1c5e8e4fdac8 (01:32): can one watch them without Flash plugin, I dont use Flash plugin so I dont have one
a26a1644beeab8cb4f433e21fb297199 (01:33): if only there was a link that someone could share about that
78bd2344ca343a42996f1c5e8e4fdac8 (01:34): so only WebM format
a26a1644beeab8cb4f433e21fb297199 (01:35): except for the part where they have h.264 listed on that page
78bd2344ca343a42996f1c5e8e4fdac8 (01:36): now all books about html4 can be throwed away ?
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (01:37): 78bd2344ca343a42996f1c5e8e4fdac8: no
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (01:37): html5 is superset of html4
a26a1644beeab8cb4f433e21fb297199 (01:37): you didn't hear about the w3c book burning party?
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (01:37): the old knowledge still applies
78bd2344ca343a42996f1c5e8e4fdac8 (01:38): is html4 antiqued somehow by html5 ?
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (01:38): a lot of html4 is still valid
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (01:39): 78bd2344ca343a42996f1c5e8e4fdac8: start learning
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (01:39): html5rocks.com
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (01:39): in terms of markup, html5 added new tags and simplified others
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (01:39): but some legacy parts were depreciated
78bd2344ca343a42996f1c5e8e4fdac8 (01:39): "HTML5 by Bruce Laweson & Remy Sharp" <- is it worth to read ?
a26a1644beeab8cb4f433e21fb297199 (01:39): and from a dom perspective adding more api's and properties
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (01:39): Introducing HTML5 by them two? yes
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (01:40): they have a 2nd edition coming out this fall
78bd2344ca343a42996f1c5e8e4fdac8 (01:40): are they good authors ?
a26a1644beeab8cb4f433e21fb297199 (01:40): 78bd2344ca343a42996f1c5e8e4fdac8 it's like, css3 shit is cool but you still use selectors that were spec'd out and designed in the css2 spec
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (01:40): i trust their knowledge, and i know others do too
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (01:40): lawson works for Opera
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (01:41): and is part of html5doctors
a26a1644beeab8cb4f433e21fb297199 (01:41): 78bd2344ca343a42996f1c5e8e4fdac8 remy sharp made html5demos.com
6d2cddd61c68e5e8d13a65f218e358f5 (01:41): 78bd2344ca343a42996f1c5e8e4fdac8, read the book and form your own opinion.
a26a1644beeab8cb4f433e21fb297199 (01:41): if you want an idea of his abilities
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (01:41): remy also runs jsbin.com
a26a1644beeab8cb4f433e21fb297199 (01:41): and used to be a jq team member: http://jquery.org/team
a26a1644beeab8cb4f433e21fb297199 (01:42): also, soft hands
a26a1644beeab8cb4f433e21fb297199 (01:42): probably moisturizes
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (01:42): remy has his own backed conference
